answers.text: a mixture of metals or a mixture of a metal and another element

qas.question: What is solid solution metal elements classified as?
What is always a mixture of metal and other elements?
What is defined by its atomic bonding character?
What type of solution has a single phase in two or more solutions?
What type of phases are always considered to be alloys?

context: <b4_0>An alloy<b4_0/> is <a0_0>a mixture of metals or a mixture of a metal and another element<a0_0/>. <b5_0>Alloys<b5_0/> are defined by <a1_0>metallic bonding character<a1_0/>. An alloy may be a <b6_0>solid solution<b6_0/> of metal elements (<a3_0>a single phase<a3_0/>) or a mixture of metallic phases (two or more solutions). Intermetallic compounds are alloys with a defined stoichiometry and crystal structure. <b7_0>Zintl phases<b7_0/> are also sometimes considered alloys <a2_0>depending on bond types<a2_0/> (see also: Van Arkel-Ketelaar triangle for information on classifying bonding in binary compounds).
